media.title: Channel News Asia Documentary
media.description:
A documentary I filmed with CNA (Channel News Asia) for a series called Raising Expectations aired on 17th February 2026.

The episode I contributed to was called "Can AI genuinely improve human health and the planet?". Apparently, they reach 150 million viewers! That is a lot of eyeballs ðŸ‘€

In the piece I talk about the research we are doing at the University of Cambridge with the Conservation Evidence project, to try and change the way we find and bring together evidence to take more effective conservation action.

If you want to watch for yourself, you can do that here! (Our section begins at ~23 mins 10 seconds): https://www.channelnewsasia.com/watch/raising-expectations/can-ai-genuinely-improve-human-health-and-planet-5928611

media.title: Cambridge University's Contribution to COP30
media.description: The University of Cambridge published a video about the University's contribution to COP30, featuring research at the intersection of AI and conservation.

media.title: AI in Conservation and Ecology
media.description: Discussion of AI in conservation and ecology on Nature in a Nutshell, the CIEEM (Chartered Institute of Ecology and Environmental Management) podcast, covering the integration of AI into ecological practice.

media.title: AI for Nature: Embrace with Caution
media.description: Feature review by the University of Cambridge on research at the intersection of AI and conservation science, discussing the potential benefits and the inevitable risks with Professor Chris Sandbrook.

media.title: AI, an Altruist's Guide
media.description: In March 2025, I was invited to take part on a panel at Wildscreen, chaired by Liz Bonnin. The panel was titled 'AI, an altruist's guide', where we discussed where AI fits in with storytelling, and the effects it may have on scientific media.
